ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

0=Cannot be assessed; 1=Patient clearly believes that he has a mental disorder; 3=Somewhat: Is unsure about whether he has a mental disorder but can entertain the idea that he might;
5=Unaware: Believes he does not have a mental disorder.

ElementDescription: Does the patient believe that he needs medication, or would benefit from it?
Notes: 0=Cannot be assessed; 1=Definitely yes; 2=Probably yes; 3=Unsure; 4=Probably no; 5=Definitely no

0=Cannot be assessed/item not relevant; 1=Aware: Patient clearly believes that he has hallucinations; 3=Somewhat: Is unsure as to whether he has hallucinations but can entertain
the idea; 5=Unaware: Believes that he does not have hallucinations.

0=Cannot be assessed/item not relevant; 1=Correct: Symptom is due to mental disorder; 3=Partial: Unsure, but can consider possibility that it is due to a mental disorder; 5=Incorrect: Symptom is unrelated to a mental disorder.

0=Cannot be assessed/item not relevant; 1=Aware: Patient clearly believes that he has delusions; 3=Somewhat: Is unsure as to whether he has delusions but can entertain the idea; 5=Unaware: Believes that he does not have delusions.

0=Cannot be assessed/item not relevant; 1=Correct: Symptom is due to mental disorder; 3=Partial: Unsure, but can consider possibility that it is due to a mental disorder; 5=Incorrect: Symptom is unrelated to a mental disorder.

ElementDescription: Awareness of flat or blunt affect
Notes:
0=Cannot be assessed/item not relevant; 1=Aware: Patient clearly believes that his affect is flat or blunted; 3=Somewhat: Is unsure as to whether his affect is flat or blunted, but can
entertain the idea; 5=Unaware: Believes that he does not have flat or blunt affect.

ElementDescription: Attribution of flat or blunt affect
Notes: 0=Cannot be assessed/item not relevant; 1=Correct: Symptom is due to mental disorder; 3=Partial: Unsure, but can consider possibility that it is due to a mental disorder; 5=Incorrect: Symptom is unrelated to a mental disorder.

0=Cannot be assessed/item not relevant; 1=Aware: Subject clearly believes that his/her communications or thoughts are disorganized; 3=Somewhat: Is unsure as to whether his/her communications or thoughts are disorganized but can entertain the idea; 5=Unaware: Believes that s/he does not have disorganized communications or thoughts.

0=Cannot be assessed/item not relevant; 1=Correct: Symptom is due to mental disorder; 3=Partial: Unsure, but can consider possibility that it is due to a mental disorder; 5=Incorrect: Symptom is unrelated to a mental disorder.
Study Site
0=Baseline; 1=In Treatment; 2=In Follow-up
1=Long-Acting Injectable Risperidone Microspheres; 2=Second Generation Oral Antipsychotic Medication

-1.5 = Pre-Screening; -1 = Screening; 0 = Baseline; ## = Visit ## (from 1 to 10); Whole numbers = standard monthly visits; #.001 - #.009 = Unscheduled; #.1 = End of Phase 1; #.2 = End of Phase 2; #.3 = End of Phase 3; #.4 = End of Open Choice Phase; #.5 = End of Study; #.6 = Genetic Analysis; 1000=all visits
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: Awareness of mental disorder: In the most general terms, does the subject believe that he or she has a mental disorder?
Notes: 0 = Not applicable; 1 = Aware; 2 = Somewhat Aware/Unaware; 3 = Severly Unaware

ElementDescription: Awareness of the consequences of mental disorder: What is the subject's belief regarding the reason(s) he or she has been unemployed, evicted, hospitalized, etc.?
Notes: 0 = Not applicable; 1 = Aware; 2 = Somewhat Aware/Unaware; 3 = Severly Unaware

ElementDescription: Awareness of the effects of medication: Does the subject believe that medications have diminished the severity of his or her symptoms (if applicable)?
Notes: 0 = Not applicable; 1 = Aware; 2 = Somewhat Aware/Unaware; 3 = Severly Unaware

ElementDescription: Awareness of the social consequences of mental disorder
Notes: 0=Cannot be assessed or item not relevant; 1=Aware; 2=Slightly aware/unaware; 3=Partial Unaware; 4=Unaware: Believes he does not have a mental disorder.

ElementDescription: Awareness of achieved effects of medication
Notes: 0=Cannot be assessed or item not relevant; 1=Aware; 2=Slightly aware/unaware; 3=Partial Unaware; 4=Unaware: Believes he does not have a mental disorder.
0=Cannot be assessed or item not relevant; 1=Aware; 2=Slightly aware/unaware; 3=Partial Unaware; 4=Unaware: Believes he does not have a mental disorder.
0=Cannot be assessed or item not relevant; 1=Aware; 2=Slightly aware/unaware; 3=Partial Unaware; 4=Unaware: Believes he does not have a mental disorder.
0=Cannot be assessed or item not relevant; 1=Aware; 2=Slightly aware/unaware; 3=Partial Unaware; 4=Unaware: Believes he does not have a mental disorder.
